DOCNAME: CASE OF GARCÍA RUIZ v. SPAIN
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant has the degree of Bachelor of Laws and is registered as a member of ORG , but in fact works as a nurse . He submitted that in DATE CARDINAL PERSON gave him instructions to carry out certain non - contentious ( extraprocesal ) work , including in particular a search to discover any encumbrances affecting the title to a piece of land which was among the property made subject to a charging order in summary foreclosure proceedings under LAW ( juicio sumario ejecutivo PERSON ) brought by the X company against S. before judge no . CARDINAL of ORG .
On DATE M. bought the land at auction , at a price which the applicant considered advantageous .

CARDINAL . The applicant maintained that in DATE he unsuccessfully asked his client to pay him for the administrative services , advice and technical assistance he had provided at the time of the purchase in question .

He asserted that , by a registered letter of CARDINAL DATE with a prepaid form for acknowledgment of receipt , to which he received no reply , he asked PERSON to pay him the sum of MONEY to cover his fees .

CARDINAL . On DATE , at the applicant ’s request , ORG gave an opinion assessing the fees the applicant was entitled to claim for the services in question at MONEY . The Bar made it clear that its assessment was based exclusively on the information provided by the applicant .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant brought proceedings against PERSON under the taxation procedure ( procedimiento de jura de cuenta ) before judge no . CARDINAL of ORG to recover the sum he claimed . Judgment was given against the applicant on DATE on the ground that the jura de cuenta procedure was intended only for the recovery of fees owed for services rendered by counsel in the context of judicial proceedings and that the services he had rendered had been non - contentious .
CARDINAL . NORP On DATE the applicant brought an ordinary civil action ( juicio declarativo ordinario ) against PERSON before judge no . CARDINAL of ORG seeking payment of MONEY .

CARDINAL . This claim was dismissed by a judgment of CARDINAL DATE . The judge took into account the statements of the defendant , who had denied the facts alleged by the applicant , and in particular that he had ever given Mr PERSON instructions to act for him , held that the evidence of a witness called by the applicant was not conclusive and ruled that the applicant had not proved that he had performed the services in question . He held in particular :

“ The plaintiff asserts that he was instructed by the defendant ( PERSON ) to perform a number of services for him consisting in checking which court was dealing with certain proceedings and providing other information PERSON considered necessary to inform his decision as to whether to buy a certain property . In support of his claim he has submitted , in addition to his pleading , a series of documents , numbered CARDINAL to CARDINAL in the file .

In his deposition ( confesión judicial ) the defendant contested the truth of the facts on which the claim is based , denying that there had ever been any kind of contractual relationship between himself and the plaintiff or that he had asked the latter to perform the professional services which he claimed to have carried out according to the defendant ’s instructions .

Be that as it may , the plaintiff admits that he did not perform the services concerned in the context of judicial proceedings ... What is not in doubt is that he must prove that he actually did perform the services in issue . In that connection , no evidence has been produced in the case which might establish the truth of the allegations ... Consideration of the evidence adduced suffices in itself to persuade the ORG that the ORG plaintiff has not satisfied CARDINAL one of the conditions for claiming lawyer ’s fees . In the absence of evidence , the claim must be rejected , especially as the defendant denies the facts . ”
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant appealed . By a judgment of CARDINAL DATE , ORG dismissed the appeal and upheld the impugned judgment .
In Part I of its judgment ( The Facts ) it stated : “ [ This ORG ] accepts and deems to be reproduced in its own decision the statement of the facts set out in the impugned judgment . ”
In Part II ( The PERSON ) it ruled :
“ The grounds of the impugned decision are accepted as pertinent , in so far as they are not incompatible with those set out below .

Firstly , the appeal is against the decision given by judge no . CARDINAL of ORG on DATE , dismissing the claim of the appellant [ that is the applicant ] , a lawyer , against PERSON , for MONEY in respect of fees owed on account of work he had done as counsel in summary foreclosure proceedings no . CARDINAL , brought in ORG . M. contests the appeal on the ground that the appellant never acted in the proceedings in question , as his legal representative in that case was Mr PERSON

Secondly , the case file does not contain the slightest evidence that the appellant [ the applicant ] acted as counsel in case no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , or at least that , as LAW requires , he took steps of a procedural nature , although he may have carried out non - contentious work ; the appeal must accordingly be dismissed and the impugned judgment upheld ... ”
ORG concluded :
“ ... ORG must dismiss , and hereby dismisses , the appeal lodged by [ the applicant ’s lawyer ] against the judgment given by judge no . CARDINAL of ORG on DATE , which is hereby upheld ... ”

CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE the applicant lodged an amparo appeal with ORG relying on the right to a fair hearing , contending that the judgment of ORG had given no reply whatsoever to his arguments . In his appeal the applicant made the following points :

“ ( a ) Indeed , [ the applicant ] did not act as counsel in summary foreclosure proceedings no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL before judge no . CARDINAL of ORG , as the impugned decision states ; he acted solely as the agent of the respondent [ M. ] , providing non - contentious services in the form of advice and assistance ( as stated in the initial application ) and in the proceedings brought before judge no . CARDINAL ; but he never carried out any contentious work ( ejercicio intraprocesal ) in those proceedings ...

( c ) ... the non - contentious work ... formed the only basis for the judicial proceedings to recover fees for services rendered ... ; ... the client unjustly obtained a financial gain ... on account of the performance of the various non - contentious services which he had requested and which were in fact performed ... ”
The applicant also stated his disagreement with the way the judge of ORG had assessed and interpreted his evidence .

CARDINAL . By a decision of CARDINAL DATE ORG dismissed the appeal on the ground that it had no constitutional relevance , observing that the ordinary courts had held that the applicant had not adduced sufficient evidence that he had rendered the professional services in issue and that assessment of the facts was a matter over which the trial courts had sole jurisdiction , to the exclusion of its own jurisdiction .
CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL of LAW is worded as follows :
“ Judgments shall always contain a statement of the grounds on which they are based and be delivered in public . ”
“ GPE sentencias serán siempre motivadas y se pronunciarán en audiencia pública . ”
CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL of LAW provides :

“ Judgments must be clear and precise and must address specifically the applications and other claims made in the course of the proceedings ; they must find for or against the defendant and rule on all the disputed points which have been the subject of argument ... ”

“ GPE sentencias deben ser claras , precisas y congruentes con las demandas y con las demás pretensiones deducidas oportunamente en el pleito , haciendo las declaraciones que éstas exijan , condenando o absolviendo al demandado y decidiendo todos los puntos litigiosos que hayan sido objeto del debate ... ”
